error.signature: 403 Forbidden: Request blocked by AWS WAF
error.regex: (403 Forbidden.*WAF|Request blocked by AWS WAF|WAFv2 .+ BLOCK|AWS-WAF.*rate-based rule)

verdict.summary: AWS WAF blocked the request because it matched a rule in the Web ACL (IP reputation, rate limiting, SQL injection, etc.).

dead_ends.action: Disable WAF entirely to unblock requests
dead_ends.why_fails: Removing WAF exposes the application to all web attacks it was configured to prevent

dead_ends.action: Set all rules to Count mode permanently
dead_ends.why_fails: Count mode logs but does not block; application remains unprotected while appearing monitored

workarounds.action: Check WAF sampled requests and logs to identify which rule blocked the request
workarounds.how: Enable WAF logging to S3/CloudWatch, use aws wafv2 get-sampled-requests to see which rule matched

workarounds.action: Add a scope-down statement or IP set exception for legitimate traffic
workarounds.how: Create an IP set with trusted IPs and add a NOT condition to the blocking rule, or use a label-based exception

leads_to.condition: WAF rate-based rules also trigger API throttling

preceded_by.condition: CloudFront passes request through WAF which then blocks it

frequently_confused_with.distinction: AccessDenied is about IAM permissions; WAF blocked is about web application firewall rules matching HTTP request patterns
